text:
Message 371 of 4024
Day of is too late to arrange for a Lugg. I would be happy to bring your TV over to swap. And grab the computer stuff that I need. It is packed.
I’d really like to see Adrian today if possible. I am hoping that we do not let our personal conflicts impact them more than we have already.
Since you are out for the night it seems like a reasonable ask
Sent:01/13/2024 at 12:24 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 01/13/2024 at 12:25 PM)
Subject:Re: Lugg today
Message 372 of 4024
This is personal to boys and I.
Adrian was very much impacted by what you did and has expressed serious concern for his safety, legality of what happened and fear.
No on tv swap or you coming to Kirkland residence.
I am not out for the night but unavailable for coordination of Lugg. My movements are not your business.
Sent:01/13/2024 at 12:30 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 01/13/2024 at 12:30 PM)
Subject:Re: Lugg today
Message 373 of 4024
You told me your movement. I just responded.
I don’t know what you are telling AD or how he is involved, but I would recommend that we keep our business between us and not involve the kids.
If Adrian has any concerns they should not come through you. I am more than happy to address with him directly or with you there. As I have asked
to do for months now, but you have refused. But acting as the gatekeeper for conversations about me to the kids as you have done since July when
you told Max that you all were divorcing me does not seem appropriate or helpful.
Sent:01/13/2024 at 12:35 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 01/13/2024 at 12:35 PM)
Subject:Re: Lugg today
Message 374 of 4024
Adrian was the one who alerted me to the monitoring. He expressed serious concern and was very alarmed.
Sent:01/13/2024 at 12:36 PM
From:Christine Moyer
To:Robert Moyer (First Viewed: 01/13/2024 at 12:37 PM)
Subject:Re: Lugg today
